Lincoln Logs.name: Lincoln Logs
Lincoln Logs.flavor_text: This is the normal flavor text.
Lincoln Logs.self_flavor_text: This is custom flavor text if it's your puzzle.

Hint 1.text: You're building a single structure by making complete words in the slots of stacked logs.

Hint 2.text: The completed words should be read in groups of two, forming a clue which you need to answer.

Hint 3.text: The six answers that lie on the same level have something in common.

Hint 4.text: Each set of six answers suggests a common type of tree.

Hint 5.text: Look at every two levels of your structure from above.  Do they make a pattern?

Hint 6.text: Each level makes a number that will be used in conjuction with the wood from the six sets of clues.

Animal Farm.name: Animal Farm
Animal Farm.flavor_text: The team from the Agriculture district has been cruelly branding some of the local livestock.  Can you put an end to this horrible deed?
Animal Farm.self_flavor_text: You found some branded animals.  What could it mean?

Hint 1.text: The word "brands" has more than one meaning in this context.

Hint 2.text: Pair companies with their animal mascots and then find out what ranch each one belongs to.

Hint 3.text: Each brand is composed of two letters from the company logo.

Hint 4.text: Each company name and its ranch share an interesting property.

Hint 5.text: What positions do the two letters appear in the logo?  This will help you figure out how to spell your final answer.

Hint 6.text: Note the positions of the letters in the logo and take the letters in the same positions from the ranch name (they have the same number of letters).  To order your answer, look closely at the signs.

Cereal Meta.name: Cereal Meta
Cereal Meta.flavor_text: This box of cereal contains 5 minipuzzles and a metapuzzle, which uses the answers from the minis.  To solve a mini (and receive hints), click on the name of the particular puzzle.  To enter the meta answer, return to this page.
Cereal Meta.self_flavor_text: This box of cereal contains 5 minipuzzles and a metapuzzle, which uses the answers from the minis.  To solve a mini (and receive hints), click on the name of the particular puzzle.  To enter the meta answer, return to this page.

Hint 1.text: Each of the five minipuzzles correspond to one of the five cereals included.  When you have all five answers, enter them alphabetically in one long string to advance your hint clock.

Hint 2.text: The free prize included is the key to the meta.

Hint 3.text: There are five different icons on your icosohedron, each one refers to the answer word of a particular minipuzzle.  To extract the answer, you might want to count the dots.

Hint 4.text: To spell out the answer, begin at START and move to the next face according to the orientation of the face you're currently on.  You're taking a certain numbered letter of each answer word.

gocrunchtheircapns.response: Yay, you solved it and brutally murdered some people!
gocrunchtheircapns.self_response: Yay, you solved it and brutally defended yourself from some people!

calciumchildrenhealthymorningsspoonman.response: Those answers are all correct.  Nice progress!

Hint 1.text: This puzzle starts with the Nutrition Facts % Daily Value

Hint 2.text: There's a fractional relationship between the lengths of the words and the % Daily Value

Hint 3.text: You need to literally take the fraction of the word. For example, 33% of HELIUM is HE.

Hint 4.text: Have you looked at a box of FROOT LOOPS recently?

Hint 5.text: Perhaps you can create some fruits by using the extra O's you've been given

Hint 6.text: There are five fruits disguised in the ring of letters.  Make special note of the colors, too, as they come into play at the very end

Hint 7.text: Change certain letters in the rings to make fruit names, and then take the changed letters in fruit order.  The color of the fruits should match the color O that you use.

healthy.response: Congrats!  You've solved the Froot Loops puzzle!

maketheletterbordermorefrooty.response: Nice progress! You've been moved forward in the hint clock.

Hint 1.text: This puzzle involves the 24 colorful clues on the box.

Hint 2.text: Solve the clues, and you might notice that the answers are related to other answers.

Hint 3.text: The answers should be grouped into 8 sets of three related items.  You may enter each group of three answers in rainbow order for confirmation.

Hint 4.text: You might want to look closely at the flavor text of the clues if you haven't already.   Also, did you notice that many of the answers feature an interesting letter?

Hint 6.text: Count up the trix pieces, do those three numbers follow a certain pattern?

Hint 7.text: This puzzle could easily be renamed Tri-X

Hint 8.text: After grouping, count the X's in each answer word and convert to ternary with the red/orange answer in the 9's place, the yellow/green in the 3's place, and the blue/violet in the 1's place. Order your groups according to the hints in the flavor text.

children.response: Congrats!  You've solved the Trix puzzle!

Hint 1.text: This puzzle involves the 9 cards labeled Useless Knowledge Quest!

Hint 2.text: What's another word for Useless Knowledge?  How about Quest?

Hint 3.text: These look like cards from a very familiar trivia game, but it's certainly hard to identify what category each question belongs to!

Hint 4.text: Each question deals falls into multiple categories from the original Trivial Pursuit game.  Can you match the questions to the colored circles on each Honeycomb piece?

Hint 5.text: Every answer should have the same number of letters. It's not a coincidence that the honeycomb pieces have the same number of holes, too.

Hint 6.text: Try putting each answer into the holes, working clockwise. But where to start?

Hint 7.text: Match the categories of a particular question with a honeycomb piece using the colored circles.  Write your six-letter answer into the holes starting at the black dot.

calcium.response: Congrats!  You've solved the Honeycomb puzzle!

Hint 1.text: This puzzle involves the ingredients section.

Hint 2.text: Try to make connections between the various ingredients and the names of the marshmallow charms

Hint 3.text: The ingredients feature two balloons, three clover, five hearts, two horseshoes, two hourglasses, three moons, three rainbows, and four shooting stars.  This is unrelated to the number of charms included in your cereal.

Hint 4.text: The number of charms of a given type is used consistently for each ingredient in its group.

Hint 5.text: Each ingredient hints at a charm type (e.g. corset = hourglass, courage = heart).  Index into the ingredients by the number of times that particular charm is included in your box.

spoonman.response: Congrats!  You've solved the Lucky Charms puzzle!

trackeightonsuperunknown.response: That message is correct.  You'll likely need to do some research to find your thematic answer.

Hint 1.text: This puzzle involves the eight pictures on the side of the box.

Hint 2.text: Each answer is the same number of letters.  As hinted by the phrase "Contents mostly included," you'll find some, but not all of the letters to your answers in the box.

Hint 3.text: Why do you think they're called Alpha-bits?

Hint 4.text: Letters of answers that appear in the box are 1s and letters that don't are 0s.  Convert this binary to letters.

mornings.response: Congrats!  You've solved the Alpha Bits puzzle!

Tracker Jackers.name: Tracker Jackers
Tracker Jackers.flavor_text: This is the normal flavor text.
Tracker Jackers.self_flavor_text: This is custom flavor text if it's your puzzle.

Hint 1.text: Looks like the BEES are clearly missing from this hive.  Can you restore order to this striped colony?

Hint 2.text: You're looking for sixteen words or phrases that contain the letter sequence BEE.  However those three letters have been replaced by three other letters.  The "scientific names" are clues to the hidden words.

Hint 3.text: After finding all the words, for further instructions focus on the new three-letter sequences.  Read them in order according to the binary markings on the bees.  Make sure you have all the bees facing the fronts of their words.

Hint 4.text: The eight flowers you're looking for aren't hidden in straight lines.  Enter all flowers in alphabetical order as one long text string for confirmation.

Hint 5.text: Each flower is a six-letter word encircling a seventh unused letter.  Flowers always start at the topmost hex of a ring.

Hint 6.text: Your final answer will be spelled out with the center letters of each flower.  But the bees must still visit them in the proper order!

nowfindeightflowersofsixlettersthenextra.response: Looks like you're making good progress!

Hint 1.text: This is a diagramless crossword puzzle with bars as dividers instead of black squares.

Hint 2.text: Use the flexi-puzzle to help recreate the grid.  The number "1" has been given to you, and it should go in the upper left.

Hint 3.text: Once you've solved the puzzle, follow 13 Down's instructions to see what takes shape.

Hint 4.text: Part 2's answer is entirely in lowercase.  Make sure to read your answer with red on the left and purple on the right.

Mining Artifact.name: Mining Artifact
Mining Artifact.flavor_text: You've unearthed an artifact that clearly was planted by a team from the mining district.  Can you solve its mysteries and kill off your foe?
Mining Artifact.self_flavor_text: You've unearthed an artifact.  Can you solve its mysteries?

Hint 1.text: The correct orientation of the artifact should be with the DECRYPT US message facing you right side up.

Hint 2.text: How are you going to solve this fracking puzzle?  Well, to start, did you count the number of holes on the top and the bottom?

Hint 3.text: The message DECRYPT US is self-referential.  Can you match up those letters to holes on the top of the artifact?

Hint 4.text: Perhaps holes don't run straight through the cube as they appear to?

Hint 5.text: You should have a small piece of equipment that may help you decode the message.

Hint 6.text: Squirt water through holes and see where it comes out on the other side.  This should give you a letter to letter translation.
